intro: Plectronia zanzibarica, commonly known as the Zanzibar plectronia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal forests and mangrove swamps. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
